intro: Bumelia navassana, commonly known as Navassa tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Its fruits are three-lobed capsules that release seeds when mature. Bumelia navassana is adapted to coastal and limestone soils, making it a resilient species in tropical environments.
